channel.title: Bug Finding Incentive
channel.description:
I was thinking that people will be reluctant to share bugs unless there is a reward. Also, it would give people an incentive to actively look for them if there was a reward.
But, what could we give them?

item.title: Bug Finding Incentive
item.dc:creator: @lil_devil420 lil devil420
item.description:
@lil_devil420 wrote:

[quote=“lil devil420, post:17, topic:436725”]do the people that reported bugs on Github already get a [Contributor]? Github username RSC-HUB

I think its only fair? if they can match ips?

also when you use a sleeping bag none of the words appear you can’t sleep lol?

can’t gain many levels after that.

will can’t do much bug finding because of that.

I’m not sure if that’s just me but… yea…

Not to sure but if that is true
if its for everybody we need some advertisements…
betas been out for a few days now.[/quote]

anyone fix this?

or is this just me…

Read full topic

item.description:
@Peter wrote:

Oh! Do I just send it through the mail?

Yes, but we should also mention that they must pay both send and return fees.
[/quote]
Deal, pm me your address.[/quote]

/dev/null

item.title: Bug Finding Incentive
item.dc:creator: @nacional nacional
item.description:
@nacional wrote:

forum privileges? Like having an avatar/signature on forums. power to sticky something a limited amount of time.
option to chat always in a certain color, for example as if they always had @red@ before they typed.
can’t think of anything else at the moment.

Read full topic

Not like it’s hard but I can’t be assed to contribute to a project/game I will never play, it’s dead already.
[/quote]

Confused then why stick around? Amusement?[/quote]
I’m interested to see where this goes even though I’m pretty sure it will die, when I’m on mopar I usually spend my time at General Discussion/General Programming.

item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

I fucked around with the fatigue for hours, server sided its an Int. The client hackshit divides the fatigue by /1000 or some shit, view my notes on my github…

We had it completely replicated at one point, you will need to ask rscshadow for the formula again.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

[quote=“Crooks, post:3, topic:436725”]Other; Fatigue;
The Fatigue is a float, RSCD uses a Interger value.[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Bug Finding Incentive
item.dc:creator: @Protosstribe object
item.description:
@Protosstribe wrote:

For the reward, perhaps add some form of contribution-points, similar to reputation-points on here. The first person to report a bug has his or her contribution-points increased by one. That way, people would still have an incentive to find and report more bugs after their first reported bug. This in combination with a rank or a title would be great.

Read full topic

item.title: Bug Finding Incentive
item.dc:creator: @NoLives NoLives
item.description:
@NoLives wrote:

I’d think people having a larger maximum fatigue pool would be a nice reward.

Read full topic

item.title: Bug Finding Incentive
item.dc:creator: @Crooks Crooks
item.description:
@Crooks wrote:

Client Bugs i’ve found. (I post it here & github) .

[EDIT:Just checked github, Joe fixed the QuestionMenu crash.]
If you talk to certer which have more than 5 options the client will crash;
questionMenuAnswer = new String[5];

XP(Next level at): it is divided by 4 (don’t think it should be that way);
gameGraphics.drawString("Next level at: " + j3 / 4, l + 5, l1, 1, 0xffffff);

Other; Fatigue;
The Fatigue is a float, RSCD uses a Interger value.

oNt: I think Contributer rank next to name is perfect.
XP boost, item reward, I don’t like that.
A rank is more than enough, indicating that you are one of Those who helped the server to be alive.

Read full topic
